para.text: Provisional Ballot Application. Except as required in Regulation .02 of this chapter, the provisional ballot application shall include:
The written affirmation required by Election Law Article, §9-404(b), Annotated Code of Maryland;
The voter registration application;
Instructions on:
How to complete the provisional ballot application;
How to mark and return the ballot;
The free access system required by State and federal law and COMAR 33.16.07.04; and
How the voter may access the free access system to determine whether the provisional ballot application was accepted and, if not, the reason why it was not accepted;
An envelope that can be sealed; and
A place to affix the applicant’s registration and oath document.
Use by Local Board. Each local board shall use the provisional ballot application prescribed by the State Board.

Number of Provisional Ballot Applications. Each local board shall provide provisional ballot applications in an amount established by the State Administrator in consultation with the election director.
Special Provisional Ballot Application. The special provisional ballot application for extended voting hours shall only require information sufficient to identify the voter.
Use by Local Board. Each local board shall use the special provisional ballot application prescribed by the State Administrator.
Instructions. The State Administrator shall provide a local board with instructions for election judges on the procedures for voting during extended voting hours.

Number of Special Provisional Ballot Applications. Each local board shall provide special provisional ballot applications in an amount at least equal to the quantities specified by the State Administrator.

section.heading: Provisional Ballots.
section.text: The content of the provisional ballot shall:

para.text: Be identical to the content of the ballot used in the precinct where the voter seeks to vote; and
Contain in a clear space at the top the words "Official Ballot" printed in large letters.

section.heading: Provisional Ballot Bag.
section.text: The local board shall provide each precinct with the provisional ballot bag required by the State Board.

para.text: A local board shall provide each precinct with a table, at least one chair and a privacy booth for voters who are issued a provisional ballot packet.
A local board may also provide a voting booth with a privacy screen for voters who are issued a provisional ballot packet.
A local board may combine the provisional voting station with the same day registration and address change station during early voting, and with the same day registration station on election day.
